qas.question: In the early days who represented party leadership?

answers.text: it was more usual that neither major party grouping (Federalists and Democratic-Republicans) had an official leader

qas.question: In early 19th century, what were 2 common parties?
What would be the purpose of organizing non majority members of  the house?

answers.text: to represent a party comprising a distinct minority

qas.question: What did the Democratic-Republicans have in 1828?
How many members of congress were there in 1828?
Who offered their view on lack of Democrat-Republican leadership in 1813?
In what year did Capitol Hill get its name?
What did the Democratic-Republicans need in 1828?
